alert.note: Alert for Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 12:51AM CDT until October 05 at 4:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Smith, Upshur and Wood. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1251 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tyler, Gladewater, Gilmer, Mineola, Lindale, Big Sandy, Hawkins, East Mountain, Hoard, Hainesville, Rosewood, West Mountain, Noonday, Winona, Union Grove, Red Springs, Pritchett and Carroll. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
